trans-unit.source: Working with Azure Media Services Jobs
trans-unit.target: Working with Azure Media Services Jobs

trans-unit.source: This topics gives an overview of how to manage Managing Azure Media Services Jobs.
trans-unit.target: This topics gives an overview of how to manage Managing Azure Media Services Jobs.

trans-unit.source: Working with Azure Media Services Jobs
trans-unit.target: Working with Azure Media Services Jobs

trans-unit.source: A Job contains metadata about the processing to be performed.
trans-unit.target: A Job contains metadata about the processing to be performed.

trans-unit.source: Each Job contains one or more Tasks that specify an atomic processing task, its input Assets, output Assets, a media processor and its associated settings.
trans-unit.target: Each Job contains one or more Tasks that specify an atomic processing task, its input Assets, output Assets, a media processor and its associated settings.

trans-unit.source: For more information on encoder settings, see Encoder Guides and Encoder Schemas.
trans-unit.target: For more information on encoder settings, see Encoder Guides and Encoder Schemas.

trans-unit.source: An encoding job is usually combined with other processing, for example, packaging, or encrypting the asset or assets generated by the encoder.
trans-unit.target: An encoding job is usually combined with other processing, for example, packaging, or encrypting the asset or assets generated by the encoder.

trans-unit.source: Tasks within a Job can be chained together, where the output asset of one task is given as the input asset to the next task.
trans-unit.target: Tasks within a Job can be chained together, where the output asset of one task is given as the input asset to the next task.

trans-unit.source: In this way one job can contain all of the processing necessary for a media presentation.
trans-unit.target: In this way one job can contain all of the processing necessary for a media presentation.

trans-unit.source: This section provides links to common tasks that you would perform when working with Jobs\Tasks.
trans-unit.target: This section provides links to common tasks that you would perform when working with Jobs\Tasks.

trans-unit.source: There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.
trans-unit.target: There is currently a limit of 30 tasks per job.

trans-unit.source: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.
trans-unit.target: If you need to chain more than 30 tasks, create more than one job to contain the tasks.

trans-unit.target: Get Media Processor with .NET or REST API.

trans-unit.source: Creating jobs
trans-unit.target: Creating jobs

trans-unit.source: A job is an entity that contains metadata about a set of tasks (for example, encoding or indexing).
trans-unit.target: A job is an entity that contains metadata about a set of tasks (for example, encoding or indexing).

trans-unit.source: Each task performs an atomic operation on the input asset(s).
trans-unit.target: Each task performs an atomic operation on the input asset(s).
